title: How much used energy comes from renewable sources in the EU?
subtitle: The share of gross final energy consumption coming from renewable sources in the European Union in 2023 is 24.5%.
textNote: Gross final energy consumption refers to the energy delivered to end-users for their consumption. Sweden, Finland and Denmark had the highest RES shares among Member States in 2023 due to strong hydro industries (Sweden and Finland as well), wind power and wide use of solid biofuels for district heating.
